com.upgrad.bde.assignment.datastructure

Class DirectAddressing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.upgrad.bde.assignment.datastructure.DirectAddressing

  • public class DirectAddressing
extends java.lang.Object
    The DirectAddressing class is an implementation of the Direct Addressing technique.

    • Field Detail

      • directAddressing

        public static EVM[] directAddressing
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the data structure used for storing the EVM records.

        This data structure is used for the ADD() and FIND() operations.

      • EVM_LOWER_BOUND

        public static final int EVM_LOWER_BOUND
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the lower bound of the range for voter_id .

        This constant is used for deriving the size of the EVM array used for storing the EVM records.

        This constant is used in calculating the index position for storing an EVM record.

        The value of this constant is set to 100000 .

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • evm_size

        public static int evm_size
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the size of the data structure which is used for storing the EVM records.

        The size is calculated using the following formula:

        size = (EVM_UPPER_BOUND - EVM_LOWER_BOUND)+1;

      • EVM_UPPER_BOUND

        public static final int EVM_UPPER_BOUND
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the upper bound of the range for voter_id .

        This constant is used for deriving the size of the EVM array used for storing the EVM records.

        The value of this constant is set to 999999 .

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VOTE_COUNT_LOWER_BOUND

        public static final short VOTE_COUNT_LOWER_BOUND
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the lower bound of the range for candidate_id .

        This constant is used for deriving the size of the VoteCount array used for storing unique candidate IDs and their corresponding voter counts.

        This constant is used in calculating the index position for storing the VoteCount records.

        The value of this constant is set to 100 .

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • vote_count_size

        public static int vote_count_size
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the size of the data structure which is used for storing the VoteCount records.

        The size is calculated using the following formula:

        size = (VOTE_COUNT_UPPER_BOUND - VOTE_COUNT_LOWER_BOUND)+1;

      • VOTE_COUNT_UPPER_BOUND

        public static final short VOTE_COUNT_UPPER_BOUND
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the upper bound of the range for candidate_ID .

        This constant is used for deriving the size of the VoteCount array used for storing unique candidate IDs and their corresponding voter counts.

        The value of this constant is set to 999 .

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • voteCount

        public static VoteCount[] voteCount
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is the data structure used for storing the VoteCount records.

        This data structure is used for the COUNT() operation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectAddressing

        public DirectAddressing()

    • Method Detail

      • ADD

        public static void ADD(int voter_id,
                       short candidate_id)
        This method is an implementation of the ADD() operation for Direct Addressing .

        It adds a record of type EVM into a static array data structure of type EVM which stores the record using the Direct Addressing implementation technique.

        The record consists of a voter_id and a candidate_id .

        The record is added at a specific index position which is calculated using the following formula:

        index = voter_id - EVM_LOWER_BOUND

        The worst case run time complexity for this operation is O(1) i.e. irrespective of the number of records, the time taken for adding a record is always constant.

        This method accepts Unique records i.e. the Key (voter_id) of each record is unique.

        Parameters:
        voter_id - is a 6 digit number of type int which acts as the Key for the record.
        candidate_id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Value of the record.

      • calculateVoterCount

        public static void calculateVoterCount(short candidate_id)
        For Direct Addressing implementation, this is a helper method used for calculating total votes for all candidates.

        It adds a record of type VoteCount to a static array data structure of type VoteCount , if the record with a particular Key (candidate_id) does not exists.

        By default, the Value (voter_count) for the record is set to 1.

        If the record with a particular Key (candidate_id) already exists then the Value (voter_count) is incremented by 1.

        The method takes as input a Key (candidate_id) .

        Parameters:
        candidate_id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Key for storing the record.

      • COUNT

        public static int COUNT(short candidate_id)
        This method is an implementation of the COUNT() operation for Direct Addressing .

        It finds a record of type VoteCount from a static array data structure of type VoteCount .

        It takes as input a Key (candidate_id) and returns the Value (voter_count) corresponding to the Key.

        It returns 0 if the record containing the Key (candidate_id) does not exist.

        The record available within the data structure is retrieved by calculating the specific index position (at which it is available) using the following formula:

        size = (VOTE_COUNT_UPPER_BOUND - VOTE_COUNT_LOWER_BOUND)+1;

        The worst case run time complexity for this operation is O(1) i.e. irrespective of the number of records, the time taken for retrieving a particular record is always constant.

        Parameters:
        candidate_id - is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Key for finding the record.
        Returns:
        voter_count is an int which represents the total votes received by a particular candidate.

      • FIND

        public static short FIND(int voter_id)
        This method is an implementation of the FIND() operation for Direct Addressing .

        It finds a record of type EVM from a static array data structure of type EVM .

        It takes as input a Key (voter_id) and returns the Value (candidate_id) corresponding to the Key.

        It returns 0 if the record containing the Key (voter_id) does not exist.

        The record available within the data structure is retrieved by calculating the specific index position (at which the record is available) using the following formula:

        index = voter_id - EVM_LOWER_BOUND

        The worst case run time complexity for this operation is O(1) i.e. irrespective of the number of records, the time taken for retrieving a particular record is always constant.

        Parameters:
        voter_id - is a 6 digit number of type int which acts as the Key for finding the record.
        Returns:
        candidate_id is a 3 digit number of type short which acts as the Value of the record.
